com.hirschandmann.image

Class ISPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • processing.core.PImage
      • com.hirschandmann.image.ISPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Runnable, PConstants

    public class ISPlayer
extends PImage
implements PConstants, java.lang.Runnable
    Image Sequence Player loads images in separate threads (use PApplet's requestImageMax to control how many image loading threads can be isStarted simultaneously)

      ISPlayer(PApplet sketch)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clean()
      stop playback and remove all frames
      int currentFrame()
      returns the current frame (image index) the sequence is currently at
      void dispose()
      stop playback and thread
      float getLoadProgress()
      returns a normalized value (0.0 to 1.0) where 0 = 0%, 0.5 = 50%, 1.0 = 100%
      java.lang.String getName()
      Get the name of the sequence (typically the folder name)
      PImage[] getPImages()
      returns the array of loaded images
      boolean hasFinishedPlaying()
      returns true if the last frame was reached
      void init(PImage[] images, java.lang.String name)
      Initialize from a pre-loaded list of images
      void init(java.lang.String folderPath)
      Initialise an existing player with a different folder path
      boolean isLoading()
      returns true as long as images have yet to fully load
      boolean isLooping()
      returns true if the sequence is set to repeat from the first frame at the end of the last frame
      boolean isPlaying()
      returns true if the playhead is automatically incremented
      void jump(int where)
      jump to a different frame (within the available number of frames this sequence holds)
      void loop()
      resume playback and loop
      void loopOnly()
      set loop flag to true, but don't resume playback yet
      void noLoop()
      stop looping
      void pause()
      pause playback
      void play()
      play/resume
      void run()
      handled by internal thread, don't call manually
      void setDelay(int ms)
      change playback rate
      void setName(java.lang.String newName)
      rename the sequence
      void stop()
      stop playback and reset to first frame
      java.lang.String toString()
      String representation
      int totalFrames()
      returns the total number of frames (images) this sequence holds
      static java.lang.String version()
      return the version of the Library.
